png

Enum ChunkType

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ChunkType>
      • png.ChunkType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ChunkType>

    public enum ChunkType
extends java.lang.Enum<ChunkType>
    Represents the various types of chunks found in a PNG image file, as defined by the PNG specification. This enum provides a centralised, type-safe way to interact with chunk identifiers and their associated properties.

    Each enum constant corresponds to a specific PNG chunk type, for example: IHDR, IDAT or tEXt, and stores its unique identifier (name), a descriptive text, a category for grouping similar chunks, and a flag indicating whether multiple instances of this chunk type are allowed within a PNG file.

    For detailed understanding of the PNG format, including chunk structure and meanings of various chunks, refer to the official W3C PNG Specification: https://www.w3.org/TR/png/#4Concepts.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

      • values

        public static ChunkType[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ChunkType c : ChunkType.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static ChunkType valueOf(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • getIndexID

        public int getIndexID()
        Returns the unique integer identifier for this chunk type. This index is primarily for internal enumeration and organising, not part of the PNG specification.
        Returns:
        the integer index ID

      • getChunkName

        public java.lang.String getChunkName()
        Returns the 4-character ASCII name of this chunk type. This is the identifier used in the PNG file format.
        Returns:
        the chunk name, for example: "IHDR"

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a human-readable description of this chunk type's purpose.
        Returns:
        the description of the chunk

      • getCategory

        public ChunkType.Category getCategory()
        Returns the category to which this chunk type belongs.
        Returns:
        the ChunkType.Category of the chunk

      • isMultipleAllowed

        public boolean isMultipleAllowed()
        Checks if multiple instances of this chunk type are allowed within a single PNG file. Some chunks, for example: like IHDR and IEND, must appear only once, while others, such as IDAT, tEXt, etc can appear multiple times.
        Returns:
        true if multiple occurrences are allowed, otherwise false

      • getChunkBytes

        public byte[] getChunkBytes()
        Retrieves a copy of the byte array for this chunk type.
        Returns:
        an array of bytes, containing the data

      • validateChunkBytes

        public static boolean validateChunkBytes(byte[] bytes)
        Validates a 4-byte array to ensure it represents a valid PNG chunk type identifier. A valid chunk type identifier must be exactly four bytes long and each byte must be an ASCII alphabetic character (A-Z or a-z).
        Parameters:
        bytes - the 4-byte array representing a potential chunk type
        Returns:
        false if the byte array is not 4 bytes long or contains non-alphabetic characters, otherwise true

      • getChunkType

        public static ChunkType getChunkType(byte[] chunk)
        Retrieves the ChunkType enum constant corresponding to the specified 4-byte chunk identifier. The input bytes are validated to ensure completeness.
        Parameters:
        chunk - the 4-byte array representing the chunk type
        Returns:
        the ChunkType enum constant if a match is found, or UNKNOWN if the chunk type is not defined

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(byte[] chunk)
        Checks if a given 4-byte array corresponds to a known ChunkType defined in this enum.
        Parameters:
        chunk - the 4-byte array representing the chunk type
        Returns:
        true if the chunk type is known, otherwise false

      • contains

        public static boolean contains(ChunkType type)
        Checks whether the specified ChunkType enum constant is defined within this enum. This method essentially confirms if the specified ChunkType object is one of the valid constants declared in this enum.
        Parameters:
        type - the ChunkType enum constant to check
        Returns:
        true if the type is found in this enum, otherwise false
